data.prayer: Father, your Word is essential for life and growth. Please challenge the 34,480 cultural Christians in the state of Dededo to read your Word for themselves today.
data.verse: It is written: 'Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.'

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Dededo, Guam

data.prayer: Spirit, please convict each believer in Dededo, Guam to take up their calling as a priesthood of believers and pray for the 37,844 lost around them.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood

data.prayer: Spirit, encourage every one of the 7,156 ordinary believers here to care for others, like a shepherd cares for his sheep.
Father, put the people who are lonely into families in the state of Dededo.
data.verse: God sets the lonely in families. He brings out the prisoners with singing, but the rebellious dwell in a sun-scorched land.

data.focus_label: Pray for the city of Dededo Village
data.prayer: Pray that God raises up new churches in the city of Dededo Village, Dededo, Guam.
Father, bless the state of Dededo with a multiplying movement of house churches.
data.verse: ...but indeed, as I live, all the earth will be filled with the glory of the Lord.

data.prayer: Father, help the stressed and anxious in Dededo, Guam know that you care for them today.
data.verse: Cast your cares on the Lord and he will sustain you; he will never let the righteous be shaken.

data.section_summary:
the state of Dededo, Guam has a population of 45,000.

We estimate Dededo has 7,156 people who might know Jesus, 34,480 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 3,364 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 6 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Spirit, teach the church in the state of Dededo to increase their prayer for your kingdom to come.
data.verse: Now when Daniel learned that the decree had been published, he went home to his upstairs room where the windows opened toward Jerusalem. Three times a day he got down on his knees and prayed, giving thanks to his God...
